title: 'Illustrated Atlas': light serif caps in 19th century book - alternatives {Mike Y, Tamas}
content:
Can anyone identify the font "Illustrated Atlas"

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202120414im_/http:/typophile.com/files/simcoe-title_3988.jpg)

Thanks
author: fzeronine

comments.content:
Well, first of all, isn't this a book from the 19th century? If so, we need a revival of something that was a metal typeface. To me this resembles [ITC Usherwood](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202120414/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/itc-usherwood/) which was designed in 1984, but I think could have been based on much older typeface styles.

- Mike Yanega

How 'bout Goudy Old Style or one of the similar Old Style typefaces (e.g. Cheltenham Old Style EF)?

--- Tamas Ferencz ---
